summary: This document is an email chain from November 2020 regarding arrangements for a client of attorney Gloria Allred to attend a meeting in Miami related to the Epstein case. The emails discuss RSVPs, travel arrangements, and name discrepancies for the client and her boyfriend.

persons.name: Diane Aldrich
persons.context: Appears as a sender/recipient in the email chain, working at the law firm Allred, Maroko & Goldberg, facilitating communication about a client's attendance at a Miami meeting.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Named as the attorney whose firm represents a client invited to a Miami meeting related to Epstein victims. Her office is coordinating the client's attendance.

connections.description: Diane Aldrich works at Gloria Allred's law firm, Allred, Maroko & Goldberg, and is handling communications regarding a client's meeting attendance.
Gloria Allred represents a client who is an Epstein victim and is invited to a Miami meeting arranged by the DOJ.

events.title: Miami Meeting Arrangements
events.description: Planning and coordination for a client of Gloria Allred to attend a meeting in Miami, involving RSVP submission and travel arrangements for the client and her boyfriend.

keyFacts: The email chain is from late October to early November 2020, showing post-conviction coordination related to Epstein victims.
Gloria Allred's law firm represents at least one Epstein victim who was invited to a Miami meeting, likely organized by the DOJ (referenced as 'ODAG' - Office of the Deputy Attorney General).
The client has a name discrepancy between her legal last name (used on ID for travel) and her professional name as an actor.
The client wished to bring her boyfriend for support to the Miami meeting.
The communications are marked as confidential and legally privileged, indicating sensitive discussions about victim participation.
